subject: Re: [junit] how to test JSP pages
msgSnippet: Hi, Thnks Rainsberger for the information. Now i m using Htmlunit to test my JSP page. But i am getting error when i create WebClient (WebClient webClient =
messageBody:
Hi,
Thnks Rainsberger for the information.
Now i m using Htmlunit to test my JSP page. But i am
getting error when i create WebClient (WebClient
webClient = new WebClient()).
The arror is NoClassDefFoundException
org/apache/commons/logging/LogFactory

I have put the common-loggin.jar file in the
classpath.
But still error persist.
can any one help me to come over this error.

Shrikant
--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:

---------------------------------
Shrikant K.S wrote:
> Hi All,
> I have one JSP page which takes some data from DB
and
> display's it. Connecting to DB, getting the data and
> displaying it all are handled in jsp page itself as
> scriplets.
> Now i want to test this JSP page.
> So how can i go about this JSP page testing.
> I m new to this type of testing. I m not getting the
> exact idea. What are the technologies to be used?
>
> Any help is hightly appreciated.
> Thanks well in adavance.

The easiest test you could write can use HtmlUnit to
visit your JSP and
make assertions about what data is shown on the page.
Perhaps you could
start there.

http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net

Good luck.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for
Programmer Testing
